roleset.name: hit
roleset.note: KNOCK-V NOTES: Member of VNcls hit-18.1-1, bump-18.4-1, throw-17.1-1. (from knock.01-v)
KNOCK-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00040. Comparison to knock.01-v. Vn class hit-18.1-1, bump-18.4-1, and throw-17.1-1. Framed by Katie. (from knock.01-n)

role.descr: instrument, thing hit by or with

example.name: prepositional thing knocked
example.text: John knocked on Mary's door with his head.

example.name: all args
example.text: the hairyknuckled knock of the Sierra Club at their doors

roleset.name: cut off by striking
roleset.note: KNOCK-V NOTES: Member of VNcls split-23.2. (from knock.04-v)

example.name: unstated instrument
example.text: [The strong dollar, which reduces the value of overseas earnings and revenue when they are translated into dollars,]-1 is expected *trace*-1 to knock 80 to 85 cents off IBM's per-share earnings for the full year.
example.arg: off IBM's per-share earnings for the full year

example.name: drink alcohol
example.text: * Knocking back drink makes the poetry flow.

roleset.name: knock down: hit and cause to go down
roleset.note: KNOCK_DOWN-V NOTES: Maybe this last example should be a separate roleset? Hard to say. (from knock.02-v)

example.name: just transitive
example.text: London share prices closed sharply lower Friday in active trading after Chancellor of the Exchequer Nigel Lawson's resignation slapped the market and Wall Street's rapid initial sell-off knocked it down.

example.name: with numeric arguments
example.text: Last Friday, [takeover traders]-1 spilled out of Hilton, *trace*-1 knocking the stock down 21 1/2 to 85.

example.name: with instrument
example.text: John knocked down Mary's door with his incessant pounding.

example.name: passivized
example.text: An increase in production at some major oil fields in the North Sea, which *trace*-1 had been knocked *trace*-1 out by an explosion in July 1988, also aided results.
example.arg: which -> some major oil fields in the North Sea

example.name: knock your block off
example.text: Can Sihanouk and Hun Sen knock off the Khmer Rouge still supported by China?
example.arg: the Khmer Rouge still supported by China?

roleset.name: knock off: copy, copying
roleset.note: KNOCK_OFF-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on more-nouns. Corresponds to VNcls steal-10.5. (from knock.02-n)

example.name: cheap knock-off
example.text: Judge John E. Sprizzo issued the order in Manhattan federal court, where Sony has accused [the tiny company]-1 of [*]-1 illegally knocking off the ``My First Sony'' line.

example.name: Args 0, 1 and PRD
example.text: A French knock - off of `` Dallas , '' called `` Chateauvallon '' and set in a French vineyard , had a good run in France , which ended after the female lead was injured in a real - life auto accident .
example.arg: called "Chateauvallon" and set in a French vineyard

example.name: arg1 and PRD
example.text: More European air time is filled with low - budget game shows , variety hours , movies and talk shows , many of which are authorized knock - offs of their American counterparts .

example.name: classic, from Brown
example.text: And if you 're as flat broke as I am , I think we-1 'll have to take the added risk of *T*-1 knocking over a filling station or something before we split for one of us to set up an alibi while the other does his dirty work '' .
example.arg: before we split for one of us to set up an alibi while the other does his dirty work

example.name: all args
example.text: I would have knocked over a liquor store for more quarters to play this game.
example.arg: for more quarters to play this game

roleset.name: impregnate
roleset.note: KNOCK_UP-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on instance in ULA. No appropriate VNcls. (from knock.09-v)

example.name: Fairly unhelpful corpus example
example.text: Two of the more common examples of British-American divergence of usage are screw and *PRO* knock up .

example.name: More informative example
example.text: Tiger Woods' porn-star ex-mistress claims the disgraced golfer knocked her up , but her stepmother is giving her story a cold shower, describing her as a "compulsive liar.

roleset.name: awaken by knocking insistently on the door (british)
roleset.note: KNOCK_UP-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on usage in ULA-masc1. No VNcls. (from knock.10-v)

example.name: Corpus example- you can see why this is different from the other sense.
example.text: In Chapter VI of Vanity Fair , Thackeray reports on Joe Sedley 's drunken avowal to wed Becky Sharp the next morning , even if he-1 had *trace*-1 to ? knock up the Archbishop of Canterbury at Lambeth , ? in order to have him in readiness to perform the ceremony .
